lead_paragraph: Military officials say they have improved intelligence and a disjointed process for identifying targets, and are now hitting oil facilities and secret cash coffers.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Its Airstrikes Are Hitting More Significant ISIS Targets
headline.main: U.S. Says Its Strikes Are Hitting More Significant ISIS Targets

snippet: Military officials say they have improved intelligence and a disjointed process for identifying targets, and are now hitting oil facilities and secret cash coffers.
abstract: United States air war commander Lt Gen Charles Q Brown Jr says in interview that his forces have improved accuracy of air strikes against Islamic State targets, and are destroying higher value targets; shift is result of faster approval process for strikes, which some critics say increases risk of civilian casualties.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
